nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils

Interface TransactionHelper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TransactionHelperImpl

    public interface TransactionHelper
    Helper for transaction manipulation
    Author:
    luis

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasActiveTransaction()
      Returns whether there is an active transaction in this thread
      <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
      Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least LockedAccountsOnPayments.ORIGIN
      <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback, boolean newTransaction)
      Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the newTransaction flag is true and if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least LockedAccountsOnPayments.ORIGIN
      <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback, boolean newTransaction, LockedAccountsOnPayments minForNewTx)
      Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the newTransaction flag is true and if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least the given one
      <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> runAsync(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
      Executes the given #TransactionCallback in a separate transaction, without waiting for the result.
      <T> T runInCurrentThread(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
      Runs the current callback in the current thread.
      <T> T runInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
      Executes the given TransactionCallback in a separate transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • hasActiveTransaction

        boolean hasActiveTransaction()
        Returns whether there is an active transaction in this thread

      • maybeRunInNewTransaction

        <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least LockedAccountsOnPayments.ORIGIN

      • maybeRunInNewTransaction

        <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback,
                             boolean newTransaction)
        Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the newTransaction flag is true and if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least LockedAccountsOnPayments.ORIGIN

      • maybeRunInNewTransaction

        <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback,
                             boolean newTransaction,
                             LockedAccountsOnPayments minForNewTx)
        Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the newTransaction flag is true and if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least the given one

      • runAsync

        <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> runAsync(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Executes the given #TransactionCallback in a separate transaction, without waiting for the result. Propagates the current LoggedUser context to the new thread.

      • runInCurrentThread

        <T> T runInCurrentThread(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Runs the current callback in the current thread. Doesn't touch the current LoggedUser context, but does ensure that CurrentTransactionData is processed (for example, commit / rollback listeners are notified) and cleared

      • runInNewTransaction

        <T> T runInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Executes the given TransactionCallback in a separate transaction. A new thread is used to prevent the new and old transactions from clashing. Propagates the current LoggedUser context to the new thread.
